definitions: the practice of excluding or not admitting other things

examples.text: these banks maintain their exclusivity by setting minimum entry standards
the event was criticized for its exclusivity

shortDefinitions: practice of excluding or not admitting other things

definitions: the inability to exist or be true if something else exists or is true

examples.text: those that maintain exclusivity of religion—that is, one particular religion is the only true religion

shortDefinitions: the inability to exist or be true if something else exists or is true

definitions: restriction to a particular person, group, or area

examples.text: those inside the circle cultivate an air of exclusivity
we have exclusivity agreements with companies

shortDefinitions: restriction to particular person, group, or area

definitions: the fact of an item or story not being published or broadcast elsewhere

examples.text: there is no sense in us sharing coverage, and we would insist on exclusivity
agents and publishers can demand exclusivity

shortDefinitions: fact of item or story not being published or broadcast elsewhere

definitions: the state of catering for or being affordable by only a few, select customers

examples.text: the hotel's emphasis is on exclusivity and luxury

shortDefinitions: state of catering for or available to only few
